      Returns a list of data fields that have the specified tag.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • extract

      public List<String> extract(String tag, String subfield)
      Extracts the values of a specified subfield from all data fields with a specified tag. If the subfield path is "ind1" or "ind2", the method will extract the indicator value. Otherwise, it will extract the subfield value.
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag of the data fields to extract from.
      subfield - The subfield to extract.
      Returns:
      A list of extracted values

    • extract

      public List<String> extract(String tag, String subfieldPath, BibliographicRecord.RESOLVE doResolve)
      Extracts the values of a specified subfield from all data fields with a specified tag. If the subfield path is "ind1" or "ind2", the method will extract the indicator value. Otherwise, it will extract the subfield value.
      If doResolve is set to RESOLVE, the method will resolve the subfield value. In other words, it will return the label that corresponds to the subfield value. If doResolve is set to NONE, the method will return the subfield value as is. If doResolve is set to BOTH, the method will return both the resolved label and the subfield value.
      Parameters:
      tag - The tag of the data fields to extract from.
      subfieldPath - The path of the subfield to extract.
      doResolve - The resolve option to use when extracting subfield values. Can be set to RESOLVE, NONE, or BOTH.
      Returns:
      A list of extracted values.

    • getKeyValuePairs

      public Map<String,List<String>> getKeyValuePairs()
      This method can produce wrong results due to the fact that it doesn't take into account the MarcVersion that the record is in. The method should be used with caution.
      Specified by:
      getKeyValuePairs in interface Extractable
      Returns:
      A map of key-value pairs for the specified Solr field type.

    • getKeyValuePairs

      public Map<String,List<String>> getKeyValuePairs(SolrFieldType type)
      This method can produce wrong results due to the fact that it doesn't take into account the MarcVersion that the record is in. The method should be used with caution.
      Specified by:
      getKeyValuePairs in interface Extractable
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the Solr field to get the key-value pairs for. Can be set to MARC, HUMAN, or MIXED.
      Returns:
      A map of key-value pairs for the specified Solr field type.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getFieldsFromTags

      public List<DataField> getFieldsFromTags(List<String> tags)
      Given the tags of the record, returns the datafields that have the specified tags.
      Parameters:
      tags - The tags of the datafields to return.
      Returns:
      A list of datafields with the specified tags.

    • getAuthorityFields

      public Map<DataField,AuthorityCategory> getAuthorityFields(Map<AuthorityCategory,List<String>> categoryTags)
      Returns a map of datafields and their corresponding authority categories. Essentially, produces a map of fields and their categories, such that the fields can only correspond to the tags that are listed in the authority categories.
      E.g. if an authority category "1" has tags "600" and "610", then the map will contain the fields that have the tags "600" and "610" as keys, and the authority category "1" as the value. Not that it isn't necessarily only two fields that will be returned, but all fields that have the tags "600" and "610".
      Parameters:
      categoryTags - The tags of the datafields to return.
      Returns:
      A map of datafields and their corresponding authority categories.

    • getAuthorityFields

      public List<DataField> getAuthorityFields()

    • getAuthorityFieldsMap

      public Map<DataField,AuthorityCategory> getAuthorityFieldsMap()
      Returns a map of a datafield of the record and the authority category of the field. That map is produced from the previously defined authorityTagsMap which maps authority categories to tags.
